comment.text: Tim and Lauren were amazing. My girlfriends and I went to Postino West Midtown to celebrate my bday and it was everything plus more. The customer service was amazing, food delicious, and the ambiance was everything that I was seeking. I have plans to return in the near future.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Meka, Thank you for taking the time to leave such a wonderful review! We are thrilled to hear that you and your girlfriends had a great experience celebrating your birthday at our restaurant. We appreciate your kind words about our customer service, delicious food, and ambiance. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

-Postino West Midtown Team

comment.text:
Oh my god... the deals here guys. $6 glasses of wine and pitchers of beer EVERY DAY before 5 pm. Bruschetta board is amazing and if you sign up for their emails you get one for free! And they validate parking for two hours! 

Loved customizing the board, my dad doesn't like tomatoes and he loved the options we chose. We also got the prosciutto panini and soup of the day (white bean italian sausage). Amazing!! 

Our bill in the end was $60 (we each got two glasses of wine!) including a nice tip for our amazing server Lauren. Everyone here made it a point to say hi to us :-) 

Ambiance: incredible. Vibes. Check out the pics. 

Literally coming back next week! LOVE postino!!!

photos.caption: couldn't even get pic before my dad dug into this panini

owner_replies.comment:
HI Anabel, We're thrilled to hear you had such a fantastic experience at our restaurant! Thank you for your kind words and for highlighting the deals and dishes you enjoyed. Looking forward to welcoming you back soon!

-Postino West Midtown Team

comment.text:
I had the pleasure of experiencing Postino's during a group event in a private setting, and I can confidently say that this restaurant is a hidden gem nestled in the heart of West Midtown. While my visit was part of a larger gathering, I am already planning to return on my own to explore more of the menu.

The standout feature of Postino's is undoubtedly the delicious food. Every appetizer we tasted during our wine-tasting event was a delightful culinary journey. The chefs at Postino's seem to have mastered the art of creating flavorful and satisfying dishes.

Our group, consisting of 60 women, was treated with kindness and accommodation by the attentive staff. They facilitated a seamless wine tasting and appetizer event, ensuring everyone felt welcome and had an enjoyable experience. The waitresses were not only friendly but also made sure the food kept flowing, maintaining a high level of service throughout the evening.

Speaking of the wine tasting, while I personally lean towards sweeter wines, I found that I only liked 1 of the options at that night (pre-selected) as the 4 other options were primarily dry or very dry. However, this is a subjective matter, as my companions appreciated the diverse wine selection. The restaurant provided a range of flavors to cater to different preferences, showcasing its commitment to offering a well-rounded experience.

The atmosphere at Postino's is a perfect blend of mid-volume, calm, and peaceful, making it an ideal setting for both group events and solo excursions. The restaurant's location in a plaza ensures ample parking, though it is worth noting that parking is paid.

As I plan to revisit Postino's on my own, I'm excited to delve into the main menu and explore a broader selection of dishes. Additionally, I look forward to discovering more wines that align with my personal taste preferences. With its combination of delectable cuisine, welcoming atmosphere, and attentive service, Postino's has certainly earned a spot on my list of go-to dining destinations in West Midtown.

What a great spot to chill over some wine or beer with a bruschetta board. Also great charcuterie boards. We really enjoyed our meal here. Such an array of delicious flavors to keep your palate entertained. That bruschetta board is a must try, you can pick the individual bruschetta slices for your board and those donut holes are a splendid way to top it off. A very chill spot. 

The staff were very friendly and attentive. Made it a very pleasant experience.
I've been here a few times. I love coming on Monday or Tuesday at 8pm for their $25 bottle of wine & bruschetta board. Service is always amazing and the food is always delicious.

photos.caption: Bruschetta board - apple fig, arugula bacon, mushroom mascarpone

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Meka, Thank you for your kind review! We're thrilled to hear that you have enjoyed your experiences at our restaurant. We appreciate your support and look forward to serving you again soon.

-Postino West Midtown Team

comment.text:
My cousin and I met here for board and bottle on Monday night and it was a great time. The heating lamps were on outside and there is a little fire place nearby. We picked 4 bruschetta and they were all good! 

Hot pepper jam, artichoke spread, fig and prosciutto, and the tomato and mozzarella. 

I also ordered the smoked salmon that came with hummus, cucumbers, and a Caesar salad. 

Because it was my first time I was offered the chef bruschetta which was a poached pear with blue cheese and candied walnuts. It was delicious as well. 

I'd recommend going on a Monday or Tuesday for the board and bottle it's a great deal!

Besides a beautiful environment, excellent food, there is a server Maximus Sommerville  who made our evening exceptional....He was so knowing, caring and so thoroughly charming....I would go back there and will because of the great evening that Maximus made for us.    The manager was hands on as well.....Adrienne L

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Adrienne, Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us! We are delighted to hear that Maximus and our manager helped make your evening exceptional. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.

-Postino West Midtown Team

comment.text:
This restaurant has been on my list for sometime. Visited on a Saturday evening for a girls dinner. We started with the bruschetta board which we absolutely loved! My favorite was the mexican corn and the apple and fig. 

For dinner I had the select two which was half of a Westcoaster panini and the soup of the moment, Chicken Noodle pesto and lemon soup. Both were okay, nothing special. I felt like the sandwich needed more of the garlic aioli which would of gave it more flavor. I also had a glass of sparkling rose which was good.

Overall, the best way to describe this place is a bougie Corner Bakery. Prices are standard and ambience is nice. I would like to try their brunch as I heard it's really good.

photos.caption: Westcoaster panini and chicken noodle pesto and lemon soup

comment.text: Everything was absolutely excellent. It was light but so filling. Our waiter, Maximus (sp)  took care of us. I will be returning.

photos.caption: Our Bruschetta board....mushroom, Mozzarella tomato and basil, smoked salmon, green apple fig brie and brussel sprouts. All EXCELLENT

owner_replies.comment:
Hi, Thank you so much for your kind words! We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your meal and the service provided by Maximus. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

-Postino West Midtown Team

comment.text: Went here for a work gathering. The service was good. I ordered the HANNAH'S FIELD salad it was good. I would go back just for that salad. Nice restaurant.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Meagan, Thank you for your feedback! We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the Hannah's Field Salad and had a positive experience with our service. We look forward to welcoming you back for more of your favorites. -Postino West Midtown Team

comment.text:
This place is a hidden gem in west midtown! Perfect for a girls night, date night, or fun brunch. Went here for a Sunday brunch and had the focaccia stack and the smoked salmon carpaccio -- both of which were SO fresh and tasty. Both had this tart watermelon radish on top which was so yummy! Our waiter was kind and attentive. They validate two hours of parking in the lot below it so make sure to not pay for parking before walking up!

Will be going again!

photos.caption: Focaccia stack (feta on the side, closest to the pic), and smoked salmon carpaccio... both deliciously fresh!

comment.text:
The hype is not real. 

The ambiance is on point- from the super chic design, toy car walls, funky furniture, and fireplace outdoors. The vibe is right for a sunny afternoon.

Unfortunately the food and service were disappointing. We ordered a little bit of everything. 

We had the bruschetta spread- each were less than mediocre. Each piece of bread was cold & under toasted, there was zero crunch in each bite. 

The Hannah's salad was a hard pass, I couldn't even  eat it. 

The chicken mozzarella panini was ok. Nothing special. 

And finally the snack skewers were the highlight of the meal. The chicken one particular had flavor & the yogurt sauce was worth a try. 

Needless to say, we wouldn't recommend this place. There's just too many great option nearby. Don't let the chic ambiance fool you.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Natasha,
Thank you so much for the kind words about our Postino West Midtown location. We enjoy the vibe on sunny afternoons too! It seems however, we have missed the mark with your dining experience. Your feedback is very valuable to the growth and continued coaching of our teams! Please connect with us if you'd like to continue the conversation at feedback@upwardprojects.com Looking forward to hearing from you. –Christine

comment.text:
Went on a Thursday evening at 5:30, we didn't have a problem walking in for a table.  The staff were very attentive, we had several people check on us throughout the time we were there.
A good variety of wines by the glass.  We split the bruschetta board (the Italiano, apple/Brie, hot pepper jam/goat cheese, and prosciutto).  The Italiano was amazing and part of the battle of the bruschetta they are doing, also reasonably priced, and I appreciate they are pre cut!
For a happy hour or tapas style place, it's a perfect fit.  Parking at the garage is $7 per 2 hours, but for the location that's about standard.

photos.caption: Bruschetta board (Italiano, prosciutto, hot pepper jam, and apple/brie)

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your experience at our restaurant, including our attentive staff, variety of wines, and delicious bruschetta board. We appreciate your feedback and hope to see you again soon.

comment.text:
Amazing food, even better service. The boards are so cute to share and very filling. The fire was the cherry on top. 

The wine and beer selection is unmatched. I really enjoyed my time here. The staff was super sweet and very accommodating.

owner_replies.comment: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to see you soon!

comment.text:
Postino has quickly become one of my favorite spots in West Midtown. With its great selection of wine, delicious snacks, and fun decor, what's not to love? 

You walk inside and the first thing you see is an awesome wall made entirely out of different hot wheel cars, funky hanging light fixtures, and lots of bright colored furniture. They also have a great outside patio if you're looking for outdoor seating.

Every single food item I've gotten here has been delicious, and my favorite option is always the bruschetta board because you can pick 4 different flavors and try a little bit of everything. Right now Postino is doing a "Battle of the Bruschetta" to decide which new flavor they'll be adding to the menu and it's such a fun concept to get to try new flavors every two weeks and vote for your favorite. So far the Mexican Street Corn has been on the top for me. 

Postino also has a wine box subscription service which is amazing! You get 4 bottles of wine every quarter and perks like a free glass of wine every month.

This location has a great amount of parking because they have a paid lot right behind the restaurant. Highly recommend for a fun little night out!

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Kelly, Thank you for your positive review! We appreciate your kind words and are thrilled to hear that you enjoy our wine selection, delicious snacks, and fun decor. We hope to see you soon and appreciate your support!

- Tina
Lead Moment Maker

comment.text:
I have passed by Postino on several occasions and have wanted to check it out and are so glad I finally made my way there. Well worth the wait! 

There is street parking and a nice size lot behind the restaurant in the Brick Works plaza. I attended on a Monday and as far as i know parking is not free. There is a pay machine or you may scan the QR code to access ParkEaz app for better convenience to register your vehicle and pay - which is what did. The first 30 mins of parking is free, however the bartender provided me their internal QR code for additional savings. Sorry I can't remember the actual amount. Moving onto the establishment. The entire restaurant is very lively and full of different pops of color. The ambiance naturally puts you in that spring/summer mood.  My friend and I opted to sit at the bar which had plenty of space for us to dine. Jaylynn (bartender) was very accommodating and was able to give great recommendations. 

My selections were as follows..

Snacky Thing of choice:
* Scrimp Scampi

Bruschetta Board of choice: 
* Sweet N' Spicy Pepper Jam & Goat cheese
* Mushroom & Mascarpone 
* Fresh Mozzarella Tomato & Basil
* Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomato 

The scrimp scampi was very good. I enjoyed all of my bruschetta choices, however, the Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomato was my favorite. 

Drink of choice: 
* 2 glasses of Rosé champagne with strawberry garnish (YUM) 

Both Jaylynn and restaurant owner Luciano were a pleasure! Luciano even went out of his way to accommodate my friend with replacing one of her items that she'd received that was not favorable unsolicited. Customer service was top notch! Postino is a great place for date night, girls night, family/ friends gathering or just a solo stop to grab a bite at the bar. The music selections were upbeat, a whole vibe! The open patio is nice and is nicely lite up for a relaxed, cozy evening. 

Shouts out and many Thank You's to the Postino crew for the stellar hospitality! A totally WIN! I'll definitely be returning. Until next time, SYOY!

photos.caption: Shrimp Scampi, Bruschetta Board and glass of Rose

owner_replies.comment: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to see you soon!

comment.text: Stopped in around 2:00 pm and we were the only people in the place.  Got a little nervous.  Glad we stuck it out!  Lots of great wine and the bruschettas were off the chain.  Best I ever had!!!  Jacob was the nicest and most knowledgeable wait staff I have ever met!  Let him lead you in your selections.  He knows the menu inside and out!  Highly recommend this place and will be back again!!

photos.caption: Tried 6 different boards to share and all were outstanding!

comment.text:
The outside of this place is to die for! We usually sit inside but i think this is the summer happy hour spot forever. The food is so great for sharing and snacking!

Lets talk about the employees here....
They brought my dog a treat because its pet friendly outside. If anyone has a pet knows this is the kindest gesture! I think every server checked in on us and they were beyond kind. I wanted to even see a brunch menu to come back and they brought two out for us. I mean the service is incredible. 

The bruschetta board: we have almost tried all of them and the best are the mushroom, salami pesto, tomato bacon arugala, and the artichoke for sure!

photos.caption: Prosciutto goat cheese, pepper jam, mushroom, and the tomato arugala bacon Bruschetta Board

owner_replies.comment: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to see you soon!

comment.text: I loved everything about this place! Staff...great, food...great, wine  cool!! The spot was a true vibe, had a DJ, decorated great, and the outside area really, really nice!! I will be going back to try and get outside.

I love postinos!! I've been to a couple of locations and I've consistently enjoyed this place. Their bruschetta boards are so fun, aesthetic and tasty. I got to try every option they have and I'd definitely go for the fig, smoked salmon, and bacon one. The best snacky thing is hands down the crispy cauliflower. It's so well cooked and flavorful, the sauce is amazing. I think people usually avoid paying for vegetables but this is THE dish to get. I'm actually trying to make a knock off version at home. The smoked salmon is also a fun board and very good, would recommend. Skewers are ok.

I think the downsides to this place is that you have to pay for parking, and they only serve beer or wine. They do have mock tails though! Otherwise the ambiance is lovely, there's outdoor and indoor seating, and it's a very nice date or hang out spot with friends and coworkers.

photos.caption: OMG Grilled Cheese Smoked Salmon Bruschetta Board

owner_replies.comment: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to see you soon!

comment.text:
This place absolutely shocked me. I cannot highly recommend it enough!!! We got a reservation for a Saturday Evening and it was easy enough. Our waitress got us seated quickly and gave us some amazing recommendations for drinks!! We ordered our wine and then got some appetizers. 

We got the meatballs and the shrimp scampi to start along with some bread for the meatballs. They were both delicious and the shrimp was great and lemony! We also got the bruschetta boards and it was all amazing and such a great deal! The brushetta boards are definitely the main attraction and you can't come here without getting one

For my main, I did the 1/2 nine iron and half Caesar salad and the sandwich and salad was amazing. Overall, the prices are amazing and the food is just amazing. The staff was excellent and it is a gorgeous restaurant. It honestly cannot be recommended enough!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your kind words and great feedback, we hope to see you again soon!

comment.text:
So happy this spot opened on the west side! Had brunch on a Saturday. The hostess was very welcoming.  Server was nice and helpful.  Every employee you encountered were nice. This is a plus! 

The space is inviting. We learned that each location pays hommage to their location.  This westside location used to be a Ford Motor Cars dealership so hence the use of cars on the wall. 

Although there was a DJ (really nice) inside, we opted to sit on the patio because the weather was great! I love the outdoor fireplace. Def a vibe.  

We had the bruschetta boards which cans with four options.  I believe we had the Burrata, Brie, and prosciutto. I can't recall the fourth one. Aye!  Also ordered the Shakshouka. It was good but I'm used to having this dish with over easy baked eggs. The eggs were instead boiled but still not cooked through which I love.  It was served with meatballs so it was filling.  Delish. 

Parking: plentiful this time of day but it's paid parking. Resto is located in Brickworks.  

I had the Bellini at brunch which was perfect.  Will return to try their wine. I suspect this will be one of my go to spots this spring and summer.

photos.caption: Outdoor. Perfect day to be outside.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the love! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

comment.text:
The service was wonderful here. The staff is very attentive and informative. This place is so cute! I love all the decorations and unique touches. In the evening, it's intimate and such a vibe. 

The crispy cauliflower was really delicious. It was tender paired with a lovely sauce. The bruschetta was so delicious! I love that you can pick 4 - the mushroom one and the burrata bacon one was a 10/10! The OMG Grilled Cheese was soooo good! We asked the bacon to be on the side. I would definitely get that again. The smoked salmon was great as well, I really enjoyed the dip.

I really enjoyed my experience here. The vibes and the food were wonderful. I can't wait to come back. 

It is paid parking but lots of parking spaces.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the love! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

comment.text: Delicious tapas! The smoked salmon and the bruschetta board are a must try if you come here. The shrimp scampi was different but also good. I'll be back to try more of the menu. Nice atmosphere, nice service, date night approved.
Great experience! The bruschetta board is large and perfect for sharing. Service was friendly and punctual. The interior is super cute - we sat outside however.

I had THE HARDEST TIME finding something upscale and open early but after riding around for some time we found this amazing wine bar!

* Decor 
I wanna start with the beautiful, cozy yet upscale decor. Your mouth literally drops as soon as you walk in, and even though it was quite beautiful on the inside, I decided to sit on the patio, which was still just as pleasant. The atmosphere was so peaceful at this time! 

* Drinks
I greatly appreciate the variety in wines and the education of the menu. There is nothing better than  looking on a menu that is detailed and informative.

* Service
I absolutely loved our kind and patient server. She was so attentive and patient with us, and did a great job with recommendations. 

* Food
This place is definitely meant for lunch. The dishes were very light and almost gave me a small plate vibe. The skewers were definitely a must have, there were so juicy and the sauce it laid on was paired so well. 

* Price
The lunch wine menu was so price so well at $6 a cup, keep in mind it was enough for two glasses. It also carried almost half of the full menu wines on the lunch menu, and who wouldn't enjoy options and variety. The food was already very inexpensive, with a most expensive dish ranging at under $25

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your kind words and great feedback, we hope to see you again soon!

comment.text:
So glad I finally got to try this place. And it won't be by last time. 
We got their Bruschetta board, shrimp scampi, nine iron sandwich and a bowl of potato soup. Everything was delicious. 
They have a $6 drink specials everyday until 5 pm. 
I will definitely be returning to try out everything else on their menu and enjoy the beautiful patio

owner_replies.comment: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to see you soon!

comment.text:
Went here for a Sunday brunch. Was surprisingly empty and we were there for a few hours. Very reasonably priced and I enjoyed the aesthetic. 

I would like to go back and try their dinner menu. Was not that impressed with brunch. The avocado toast did not have much avocado and it was brown by the time it came out. Portions were small. Not much variety in the options. However, the fritters were a hit (pic attached). All in all was kind of disappointed but I still have hope so will return.

I'm obsessed! I absolutely love this restaurant and it's now one of my favorites. It has a cool, laid-back vibe with unique decor. Tons of indoor and outdoor seating. All of the employees were super friendly. I was shocked by how empty the restaurant was on a Saturday, that being said, everything came out very quickly. All of the food we tried was delicious. I highly recommend the shrimp scampi and brussels sprouts salad. There's a large selection of wine. We tried a few different wines, but the Riesling was my favorite.

photos.caption: Nine Iron & Chicken & Mozzarella Sandwiches, Brussels Sprout Salad, Soup of the Moment (jalapeño corn)

comment.text:
I was invited to visit Postino today as being a member of Wise. And today was a special day as they had all employees in training for the upcoming opening on Monday so everything was comped for all visitors. 

I was glad to assist in their training!

Upon arrival, I parked in the parking lot which is quite spacious behind the facility. But you will have to pay unless you are only there for 20 minutes which is highly unlikely for any restaurant. 

When I walked in, I noticed the place was bustling with people but not overcrowded. Everyone had enough room to sit and enjoy their wine and/or food. And I loved how the restaurant looked. 

As part of this day, you could pick different items off of the menu to try, an appetizer, entree, dessert and one drink. I started with the sweet potato wedges recommended from the waitress that assisted me the most (note on this day any of the wait staff could stop by to help but Victoria was my main contact). The sweet potato wedges were ok. I wouldn't recommend them unless you enjoy very salty food. 

Now for the entree, I didn't want a huge meal. So I asked for another recommendation she pointed out they half and half meals. So instead of getting a full panini I could get half with half salad/soup. I went with that option and was quite please. The Nine Iron panini was delicious! Flavorful! And omg I have never been so impressed with a salad before! The mixed greens salad was delicious! It had a sprinkle of feta cheese, some grapes and pecans to top off the greens!

And by the way, I had a glass of Malbec which was great! The brand was Espiritu. The right amount of dryness. 

Lastly, I had the crème brûlée for a dessert which was great and recommended by my waitress. It came with a side of strawberries and it was delicious! I devoured the dessert lol. 

Overall I was quite pleased and will return! And Victoria was a great waitress. She was very personable and knowledgeable. I hope she has a great experience working there.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the love! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

comment.text: I love this place... the charcuterie boards are fantastic and the wines never disappoint. You can do this spot solo or with a group, it never gets old.

I had been hearing such amazing things about this place, so naturally, I was excited to give it a try. However, I have to admit that it didn't quite live up to the hype for me. The reviews were stellar, but my experience left something to be desired.

Let's talk about the food first. We ordered four types of bruschetta: Smoked Salmon & Pesto,  Ricotta, Dates & Pistachio, Brie, Apple & Fig Spread, and Fresh Mozzarella, Tomato & Basil. I also got the OMG Grilled Cheese, and I can't deny that they were tasty. Each bite was satisfying, and I have no complaints about the flavors. However, what bothered me a bit was that everything felt a bit cliché. I was hoping to find something unique and special, that kind of dish or feature that makes you think, "Wow, you can only get this here!" Unfortunately, that was missing for me, and it left me wanting a bit more excitement in my dining experience.

On the positive side, their wine and beer selection was decent, offering a variety of options to choose from. The staff was friendly and provided good service, which is always a plus. I also appreciated the fact that they have both indoor and outdoor seating, and the place is quite spacious.

While I'm not bursting with enthusiasm to go back right away, I would be open to giving this place another chance. Maybe trying different dishes or visiting on a different day could make a difference. I believe there's potential for improvement, and I'm willing to explore it.

In a nutshell, my experience at this place was not mind-blowing, but the food was good, the staff was friendly, and the indoor/outdoor seating options were nice. I'll keep it on my radar for a possible revisit, hoping to discover that extra spark that will truly make it stand out.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Helena, Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We apologize that your dining experience did not meet your expectations in terms of uniqueness and excitement. We appreciate your compliments on the tasty food, friendly staff, and our indoor/outdoor seating options. We will take your feedback into consideration to improve and hope you'll give us another opportunity to impress you in the future.  I would love to connect with you further at feedback@upwardprojects.com so we can provide an even better experience in the future! I look forward to hearing from you. 
- Tina
Lead Moment Maker

comment.text: Visiting Atlanta and looking for something delicious, this is the place! The service was excellent, and the manager even brought us an extra bruschetta of the one we liked best. We were celebrating my birthday and vibes were classy and cool.  *word of warning, don't pay for parking until in the restaurant, they will give you a validation code.

photos.caption: 4 kinds of bruschetta, artichoke spread, apple fig Brie, goat cheese and hot pepper jelly and ricotta, date, pistachio.

comment.text: Great service and great ambiance. The food was ok , I was limited to what I could eat (pregnant). However, the shrimp dish was the best to me and I loved the location and ambiance. I'd definitely return!

I absolutely love the bruschetta boards at Postino! This is such a good date night spot or a girls night spot! The only down side for this place is the parking -- you have to pay to park at this location. 

The service is great and you'll almost always see a manager walking around just checking on tables. I'll definitely come back!

Great brunch place, love their bruschetta boards! Both food and drinks are reasonably priced, especially the drinks. Most recently, we hosted a brunch for my husband's birthday and our friends were shocked at how well priced the drinks were. The waitress that served our party was extremely friendly. All in all, a great place for a brunch date or get together with friends. 

Also, they validate parking now up to 2 hours! :)

Great restaurant. Nice atmosphere with a patio. 

Food options are minimal. If you're a big eater you may leave wanting more.we had a sandwich with a salad.

The server accidentally brought someone else's meal to our table so they let us keep it since they couldn't give it to the people. It was a smoked salmon plate. So delicious.

I appreciate the manager for correcting the restaurants error. I'd definitely return.

We had the best meal at Postino, and got to sit out on the patio to enjoy some great weather. We got a couple of glasses of Bouchon wine which was very tasty, the OMG grilled cheese which was SO good  (the tomato soup that came with it was incredible too) and a bruschetta board with Brie, Apple & Fig Spread, the Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomato, the Mushroom & Mascarpone, and the Prosciutto Di Parma, Fig & Mascarpone. Everything was sooo good but our fave was the Brie, Apple, and fig spread. We got the chocolate lava cake for dessert! We loved this concept of the bruschetta board, and can't wait to come back with friends! So pumped about their happy hours and deals too!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your kind words and great feedback, we hope to see you again soon!

comment.text:
The first Postino I went to in Atlanta was the original location in Buckhead so I was very happy when this Postino location opened up in West Midtown. 
When you walk in the space is so bright open and colorful (I love the jade green seats at the bar!). I also like that the bar has garage door-style windows on the back side that can be opened up to the patio on days where the weather is beautiful.
     I sat at the bar and ordered the Crispy Cauliflower, Skewers Snack, Shrimp Scampi, Vegetarian Panini, a Bruschetta Board (with Burrata Bacon Arugula, Mushroom & Mascarpone, Pepper Jam Goat Cheese, and Brie Apple Fig), and another Bruschetta Board (with Pepper Jam Goat Cheese, Burrata Bacon Arugula, Mozzarella Tomato Basil, and Mushroom & Mascarpone).
     I really enjoyed the grilled petite filet skewer but not so much the chicken skewer so I replaced it with another steak skewer instead. I must say that the sicilian garlic yogurt that came with the skewers was so good! I also fully enjoyed the choices I made for my Bruschetta Board and would get them all again. I also had a glass of the Pinot Bianco-Sauvignon and a glass of the Cava to drink. Both wines were tasty.
     Overall, this was a great visit with a very relaxed vibe and I will definitely be returning.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your kind words and great feedback, we hope to see you again soon!

comment.text: This establishment is so cute, the food is good The service is amazing as well. There's a parking deck there too but you have to pay for it. We went on Saturday around noon. The restaurant was not packed, but we decided to sit outside on their deck. We ended up getting the bruschetta board and the chicken mozzarella sandwich. Everything tasted good but I felt that the menu was very limited and I wanted more.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the love! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

comment.text: Such a fun spot for a girls night or friend date! I love their bruschetta boards. The inside is so bright and lively. The meatballs and goat cheese are so tasty! They have paid parking out back as well.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your kind words and great feedback, we hope to see you again soon!

comment.text: My friend and I went to Postino for a late lunch today and we loved it! The atmosphere was very cute and trendy. The service was extremely attentive, accommodating and friendly, which was greatly appreciated! We ordered the Sparkling Rose and Cabernet Sauvignon  during the $6 glass of wine happy hour special. Both wines were great! We also ordered the sweet potato wedges, chefs charcuterie board, nine iron panini w salad, and west coaster panini with potato leek soup. The sweet potato wedges were just okay, but everything else was phenomenal!! All of the ingredients were very high quality and flavorful. The prices were also extremely reasonable. Overall, we absolutely loved our experience at Postino!!

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Br'Shawn, Thank you for taking the time to leave such a positive review of your experience at Postino. We're thrilled to hear that you loved the atmosphere, attentive service, and the quality and flavors of the food and drinks. We appreciate your feedback and hope to serve you again soon.

-Postino West Midtown Team

comment.text: I was lucky enough to be invited here for a Yelp event, and I'm so glad I was. Postino is beyond a gorgeous restaurant with beautiful decor and very welcoming staff. My boyfriend started with a glass of red wine and ordered the smoked salmon dip as an appetizer. My only description is don't think about it, just order it. I was truly amazed at how delicious the dip and smoked salmon was. Since we weren't too hungry, we ordered a charcuterie board to share. This was my first time trying a board, and this definitely exceeded my expectations. The vast variety of meat, cheese, dip, and bread all paired well together. Overall, this restaurant is a 10/10, and I can't wait to return again.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the love! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

comment.text: I visited for lunch with friends. The experience was awesome!! The ambiance is class and relaxed. There were options for my vegetarian friends and us meat eaters. The wine was delightful.  The presentation is first class. Oh and most of the service was EXCEPTIONAL!! Tim was so friendly and Nya was very attentive and another (name began with J). Its obvious they love what they do and they appreciate their customers. I will definitely return!! Thank you all for great food and service!!!

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Laura, We're delighted to hear that you had an awesome experience at our restaurant! We appreciate your feedback and look forward to welcoming you back soon.

-Postino West Midtown Team

comment.text:
I had a certified 5 star experience here. I came by for lunch and was greeted by a very friendly hostess and server. The vibe is so cute inside and outside but the patio is to die for. The yellow umbrellas and layout remind me a bit of Miami. They have lights out on the patio as well so I'm sure the night time vibe is super cute as well.

I had the grilled cheese with tomato soup and the bruschetta with apple and goat cheese and the other one had a red pepper paste. All super flavorful and tasty I really enjoyed it. They also have a wine happy hour every day (unheard of!) so I'll definitely be back for a $6 glass of wine. I tried the rose and it was crisp and refreshing.

The manager Tim came by to check on me and a few other tables and he was really nice and friendly as well. Overall definitely 5 stars and I'm looking forward to coming back for lunch and dinner another time!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your kind words and great feedback, we hope to see you again soon!

comment.text: Very cool space. Service was great and the food was delicious. We were treated to a sweet donut dessert.

photos.caption: House made donuts and dipping sauces....on the house! Sweet surprise!!!
Amazing bar with Hotwheels and MatchBox cars.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Addie, Thank you so much for your review! We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our cool space, great service, and delicious food. We're glad you enjoyed the sweet donut dessert as well. We appreciate your feedback!

-Postino West Midtown Team

comment.text: The prices for some will made cocktails should be enough for you to check out this slickly styled restaurant. An open friendly indoor atmosphere flows directly into a great outdoor space with a live DJ, possibly only on weekends, with some seating that ranges from the traditional to more of an outdoor living room arrangement. Everything tried was enjoyed. Simple flavors treated well. They have a killer happy hr menu that goes until 5pm. Service was attentive and was always available before I even knew I needed something! Great Job all around!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the love! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

comment.text: Postino was nice, decor was classy. I love that they have an outdoor patio setup. They area is in a good location. Food wise it's pretty much a snack restaurant or appetizer style restaurant. We enjoyed the Table cheese charcuterie, the bruschetta board, and the Maitake mushroom snack. The sauce was really good. The mushrooms tasted a bit like some type of nut. Customer service was amazing they were very attentive. Also, this is a great space for a date.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your kind words and great feedback, we hope to see you again soon!

comment.text:
12/10 would recommend between the Dj, the ambiance, service and just overall feel of the place will definitely have you coming back and that's even before the food comes! 

Tim was is and always going to be perfect. Very attentive and funny and accommodating. I have a pine nut allergy and he made sure to check that it was safe for me to eat the Salmon and pesto bruschetta. 

Drinks -Prosecco, Curator and two hard ciders (urban tree and shackbury rosé, all mildly sweet and perfect for pairing with the bruschetta board 

Food- Chefs kiss with slick. (Strong on the slick suggestion) 
We ordered the Skewers ‍ filet alittle salty, chicken perfect, the Sicilian garlic yogurt NEEDS TO GO ON EVERYTHING !!!! I would come back for this alone! 

We also ordered the create your own bruschetta 
- Brie, apple & fig spread (PERFECT) 
- Fresh mozzarella, tomato &basil(add alittle balsamic)
-Smoked salmon & pesto ( wish the salmon was colder) 
- Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomato (a sauce is needed you only taste the bacon maybe jamming it) 
-Prosciutto Di Parma, Fig & Mascarpone (PERFECT) 

Overall I will definitely be back and trying other stuff on the menu.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the love! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

comment.text: I have never been to a wine bar, so this was a new experience for me. We sat outside because it was a beautiful day and the atmosphere was a total vibe. I swear everyone on the staff check on us. They were all polite and professional. The bartender was fantastic. The food was definitely on point. We order several things for the table and everything was good. I had the wine cocktail Killer Queen and it was delicious.  The only negative was the bathroom was way too dark. I had to run the flashlight on my camera on to make sure I locked the stall properly. Other than that, it was great. Definitely planning to go back.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the love! We look forward to seeing you again soon!
